Mr. Villa de Melo, August 11, 1841

Sir

I have taken note of your most appreciated letter of the 6th of the current month and, in responding to the Minister, I cannot help but tell him that, grateful for the honorable expressions of friendship with which the Minister has treated me even before knowing me, I must tell the Minister that here or at any post he must count on the friendship of a very republican Oriental.

Regarding the horse the Minister mentions to me, you may be sure that I will look for it and that I shall send it to you as soon as possible.

Without further ado, command with the frankness you please your friend and yours faithfully,  
Manuel de Aleman

Answered August 19, 1841.
